intro: Giliastrum rigidulum subsp. acerosum, commonly known as the rigid gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the tribe Lophopyreae within the subfamily Phyllanthoideae of the family Euphorbiaceae. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. Its leaves are typically linear to lanceolate, with a rough or hairy texture. The species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
